text: biologists have long marveled at the
complex social behavior and insects now
a team of roboticists has managed to
mimic the foraging strategy of
leaf-cutter ants the team used computer
simulations of small robots whose
behaviors evolved over time the robots
start out with just a few simple
behaviors like moving and grabbing
objects but they're not pre-programmed
with instructions on how to retrieve the
green blocks and bring them to the nest
at the bottom of the slope gradually
small changes in the robots programming
cause some of them to stumble onto
productive behaviors at the end of each
simulation the robots that performed
well are more likely to go on to the
next round eventually a system develops
some robots drop blocks from the top of
the slope and others collect them at the
bottom this is the same system used by
leaf cutter ants
you
